channel.title: Comments on: AJAX Edit In Place With Prototype

item.title: By: Bradz
item.dc:creator: Bradz
item.description:
Hi, im new to ajax but the script would be very useful on a site im designing, is it possible to password protect the edit text or perhaps have it on a password protected page but the effect is also on a live page..does that make sense?
Bradz
item.content:encoded:
Hi, im new to ajax but the script would be very useful on a site im designing, is it possible to password protect the edit text or perhaps have it on a password protected page but the effect is also on a live page..does that make sense?

Bradz

item.title: By: bobjpg
item.dc:creator: bobjpg
item.description:
Hi,
edit in place is marvelous ;-)
My problem is: i am trying to make it work with "autocompleter" from http://digitarald.de/project/autocompleter/
Prototype and Mootools have conflicts :-(
Does anyone ever done this?
Thanks a lot...
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

edit in place is marvelous üòâ

My problem is: i am trying to make it work with “autocompleter” from http://digitarald.de/project/autocompleter/

Prototype and Mootools have conflicts üôÅ

Does anyone ever done this?

Thanks a lot…

item.title: By: Design Shrine | AJAX SCRIPT RESOURCES
item.dc:creator: Design Shrine | AJAX SCRIPT RESOURCES
item.description: [...] AJAX Edit In Place With Prototype May 08, 06 Late last year Drew McLellan posted a great article on 24ways.org called Edit-in-Place with Ajax. Using Flick as an example and Prototype to do the heavy lifting he showed how to edit text inline. Like many other people I’ve been fascinated by this approach to altering text. After playing with Drew’s example off and on I finally sat down and decided to generalize it a bit more to make it easier to use. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] AJAX Edit In Place With Prototype May 08, 06 Late last year Drew McLellan posted a great article on 24ways.org called Edit-in-Place with Ajax. Using Flick as an example and Prototype to do the heavy lifting he showed how to edit text inline. Like many other people I’ve been fascinated by this approach to altering text. After playing with Drew’s example off and on I finally sat down and decided to generalize it a bit more to make it easier to use. […]

item.title: By: Stefan
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: I was playing with Edit in Place and I found maybe a small bug. When I am editing HTML content and I put it between .and. edit in place stops working. Can somebody help me to figure out why? Thanks
item.content:encoded: I was playing with Edit in Place and I found maybe a small bug. When I am editing HTML content and I put it between .and. edit in place stops working. Can somebody help me to figure out why? Thanks

item.title: By: The hunt for AJAX/WYSIWYG 'edit in place' « Matt’s Musings
item.dc:creator: The hunt for AJAX/WYSIWYG 'edit in place' « Matt’s Musings
item.description: [...] I found an article by Joseph Scott, a a few others like it, on edit in place functionality for a web page based on Prototype to produce almost the same behaviour as you get on Flickr. [...]
